title: How to audition for KPOP online? I really don't know how. How do I do it? Can someone give me advice and help me - Quora

response.answer_text: Now if u want to audition online then u should probably know all the companies (atleast top 15) official email id's. Or if u like u can also search on Google or chrome about kpop audition ex: YG audition, JYP audition, SM auditions, CUBE audition, JELLIEFISH auditions…and more, all companies have their own auditioning websites too. But it's better to write an email, because through an email u can write whatever u like(extra) : WHY DO U WANT TO BECOME A KPOP STAR? This is a very common question which is asked in atleast every audition so, it's better that u answer it before hand…( to increase the chances of ur getting selected)only if u have a good reason like: everyone says that they like singing and dancing so they want to become this…so obviously u have to come up with something different and new. (1)TELL EVERYTHING: tell about yourself properly and don't be fake or stupid(while writing the email). obviously those people have been taking auditions from a long time so they can see through u even in the mail id. (2)SELECTED: if u get selected u will get an official email by the company telling u that u r selected and then u can come for a closed audition…that will take place in ur country. So obviously u have to write ur email id and address also that they can tell u the nearest place they will be taking an audition. Then u have to choose one place and then write one more mail to the company telling them that u will see them at XYZ place at XYZ time. And let me tell u that they look confidence in their auditions that's why they are calling u so give ur best and be open. (3)IF U PASS: if u manage to pass that too then there's no stopping you. You will directly fly to Korea. The company will send u an email telling u that u r selected and the stuff u would require for living a trainee life. Then maybe after 2–3 days they will send u a letter in which ur ticket will be present and it depends if u r below 14 year then a parent's ticket will also be their and if u are not then only for u. Rest passport and visa u will have to take care of. There will also be a contract in the letter and after some time the company might tell u to come to their office and will discuss about the rules and regulations and rest procedures and policies of the company. After u get selected then u know what you have to do…Practice, going through tiring schedule and school. Bye wish u a happy auditioning 👍👍👍 bye

1. Dress well Don't turn up in your pyjamas, but also don't go full Lady Gaga! Show some star quality - style that hair, keep the make-up light, and be sure to wear clothes that are trendy yet easy to move around in. 2. Practice, practice, practice Everyone will be itching to get through the auditions so you need to stand out from everyone, by being the cream of the crop - and the only way to do that is practice. Not only will this prepare you for your audition, but this will help calm those inevitable nerves! 3. Get used to the waiting Even established K-pop stars have to wait hours-upon-hours to appear on music shows, so be prepared to wait. In the meantime, be sure to mentally get yourself ready, have those vocal cords ready, and get those muscles warmed up! 4. Be prepared to expect the unexpected Auditions may not be as simple as "turn up and sing" - judges may throw some surprises at you, such as getting you to sing your song acapella style. Be prepared for all scenarios so you don't get thrown off-guard. 5. Don't perform a song done by a company's artist If you're at a JYP audition, DON'T PERFORM A SONG FROM A JYP ARTIST! You will only be compared to the original artist, so unless you can perfectly sing something, choose a song from a different company! 6. Pick a song that's suited to you (and your voice) If you have a low vocal range, stay away from songs filled with high-notes (and vice versa)! Treat the judges as your audience and be sure to connect with them through your performance - just a simple cover won't be good enough, so be sure to pick a song that showcases your character while also bringing something new to the cover. Upbeat songs are definitely good picks! 7. It's not the end of the world if you don't get in first time around If you don't get through the first time around, it's not the end - some of the greatest K-pop stars failed at several auditions before making it. Take heed of all the advice and be sure to work on all areas that need improvement.

Tip #1: Practice. Practice. And Practice even harder. Work and train to improve your talents and skill. If you have the potential in singing then you have to do things like knowing your strength and weakness. In dancing, train to control your body and think of every training there is concerning that field. And if you want to be a rapper, then practice your words, beat and timing, the delivery of the song, the power of your voice. Tip #2: Focus This comes with practicing, since you want to join kpop online audition, you need to FOCUS on your audition. You have to focus in practicing specifically on the performace you will pass to that company. You will improve with just focusing in that performance in showcasing your talent so it is a win win. Tip #3 VidYou Another tip in improving your skills is recording yourself at least everyday and try to look for something that is needed for improvement. Find some awkward parts in your performance and work on it. Everyday you will improve. Another advantage is that you will know the perfect angle for you to look right in the video and even the clothes you wear (are you looking haggard in that clothes or maybe you look too stuffy and uncomfortable or it will not show the curves of your body since it matters) and also your hair. This is not really important but it matter and will affect the video. Tip #4 Choose wisely Pick the perfect genre for your performance and also perfect for you. Choosing the right genre of music or dance in your performance will bring out the best in you and will really show more of your potential. That will lead to a fortunate results. Tip #5 Prepare Nothing really beats preparation. Generally speaking, you have to be ready and prepared in everything. Emotionally, physically and mentally. That is my tip for you! Good luck!

Okay, you dont attend it. Since it is online, you can go to a company's website and find it. JYP for example have online auditions. In fact, here's a link If u pass this, u get called to Korea for a second audition. That's the final one and if you pass that, they offer you a contract deal and if u take it, you become a trainee! This goes for any kcompany. Not all KPop companies have online auditions though, for example, Rainbow Bridge World (Mamamoo’s company) don't and only have live auditions which only take place in their building. I highly recommend though, researching on do's and dont's for online auditions and researching on which company is ideal for you. No company will be perfect, but find the one that you think you have a good shot in, or serves your style, or for example foreigner well, if ur a foreigner. Look at the pros and cons. If you need help in that, I could give further detail on that. Anyways, good luck! It's not very easy to get cast from an.online audition so make sure to stand out and give it your all. Please take my tips to mind and I hope you succeed! 💓 Kashvi ♥️

Wear something normal and casual. *DO NOT WEAR SOMETHING ABOUT YOUR IDOL. THIS WILL GIVE JUDGES BAD IMPRESSION*Sing with emotion and have a acceptable voice *u don’t have to be REALLY REALLY great. They will train you during the trainee days so do not worry*Your hair must be neatDon’t wear “too much”.Less makeup(put only a little Foundation that’s it). Judges want to see your natural beauty.Look at the judges while singing or camera(if there is a camera)Smile a little bit while singing (try to. If you can’t, it’s fine)Eat before audition. This way can make less your nervousness.Practice 2 English song and 1 Korean Song. They want to hear you sing at least 30s for each song. If you sing well, they want you sing more to show how well you are. Prepare 3 songs( 2 English, 1 Korean)Pray and always be calmPractise a little bit when you’re waiting. Some staff will pass by and check them. Staff will tell the judges about you if you give them good impression.Confident but not too much. Don’t show your nervousness.If you passed for the first audition, they will call you. For the second audition, you must do your best since IT IS THE LAST STEP FOR YOU TO BECOME A REAL TRAINEE. Good luck. Consider some good company:)

I’m answering this purely because it was requested of me. I have never done a kpop online audition. But some tips based off from what I’ve seen would be Know your strengths and play them well. Don’t go crazy e.g if you have a low vocal range don’t suddenly choose a song with a high vocal range (unless, of course, you are capable of reaching those notes.)Look presentable. It’s a small thing but it helps.If possible get a good camera and have good audio quality. Having bad audio quality can affect the video.If you’re going to dance, make sure on getting the routine completely clean. You should look into what the company you’re auditioning values more. In my opinion it would be better to have cleaner moves then a really hard routine and not completely nailing all the moves if that makes sense.I wish you the very best in your audition ^_^

If/when there is a dance requirement, do NOT dance to the original choreography. They want to see if you can really dance to the music with your own creativity. I watched somewhere along the lines of “hunt for a kpop star” for cube entertainment, and there were so many people just doing the same dance over and over like the “I’m the Best” hand flaps and the falsely impressive leg drop. There was another popular one when the people do hip thrusts. And “Bubble Pop;” barely any stage presence to work with (yet the people chose that song?? two or maybe three people actually got in using it, but that’s pure luck and maybe they had something unique to present.)

Let them know who you are. Introduce yourself to them, just like how you would do it in person. Here’s some questions to answer: What’s your talent? (You should/could also add any other talents like language skills or anything else you think an idol would need to have that you have)Do you have any experiences regarding your talent; winning a talent show etc?Why do you want to become an idol? What can you offer? Are you willing to work hard?If you answer these 3 questions in full, you would have quite a solid self-introduction. Of course, include your name, age and where you are from.

response.answer_text: Hi there! First, sing a pop song. But if you really good with ur Korean pronunciation, so you can sing a K-pop song. Second, if you’re audition for JYP or the another company, I really recommend you to not sing a song that was from SM or YG or etc(if you choose to sing). Third, try to sing better than the original singer. Fourth, for sure don’t choose a rock and roll (lol)..try sing a smooth song and relax. Fifth, enjoy it! Good luck!

Well, as you know most of kpop idols can speak and understand korean even if they’re not completely korean, i think that’s essencial Sadly, there’s not high level of companies who would risk with a completely foreigners, but if you’re very good at singing and dancing, even if you don’t have asian traits, you may be able to go onto next step after sending your skills video! Also keep on mind that trainees have such a hard and tiring rutine, and no all trainees can debut, they waste a lot of years of training and no ones know what kind of abuses and mistreatment you will get there, but i really really wish you could realize your dream, keep on working!

I can only think of one thing off of the top of my head, and this goes for ALL auditions: please, do not sing/rap and dance at the same time. It's not impressive, usually, it's just cringey. If you look at some auditions where there are people singing and dancing at the same time, it's pretty much a train wreck. Now please don't comment things like "oh it makes you look more like a kpop idol" or "some people make it work". No, it doesn't make you look like an idol, it makes you look like you can't control your breathing and you'll be completely out of breath, and yes, SOME people make it work. That is, very few do. I wish you the best of luck with your audition ❤️

For singing, please practice well and choose songs that really suit your voice. Do not exaggerate to make yourself look better. It’s okay to choose non-Korean songs. For dancing, it is better to come up with your own dance moves. There are plenty who can cover Kpop dances out there. Try to not choose Korean songs that have choreographies, or if you do, replace the moves. For rapping, speed is not everything. You don’t have to go fast. You just have to keep with the flow and it’ll be alright. Try not to cuss here. It would be better if you compose your own rap too. You don’t have to overdress. You just have to dress casually and put minimal makeup. If you have long hair, tie it up so that it looks neat. Get a good camera and ensure your audio is alright.

I haven't auditioned, therefore I'm not sure. If I were to guess though, I think it’s similar to what you say in a interview for a job. So things like: Your name (obviously), age and where you are from.Whats your talent (or talents).Since when have you been harvesting the talent. (or how if you want to)What previous experience you’ve had.And lastly, why you're interested in that specific companyTry to make it short, but not too short. I think a small paragraph of around 5 sentences should be good. Good luck with the auditions!

First off, it takes a lot of training. It’s just like being at a real audition. You have to make sure you reach the weight they want you to be and most times things like these are hard so you have to go on a diet. You also have to train yourself in the 3 main areas of kpop; singing, dancing, and rapping. Don’t just neglect one area. Trust me, you’ll stand out if you do this. Once you feel you’re ready, go for it! Of course you’ll become a trainee but it’s good to be prepared!

Even though auditioning online can be difficult and has low chances of being successful due to the high volume of emails that entertainment companies receive, Lorraine Min pretty much answered your question. However, you should do your research well on what company you’d like to audition for and also research whether you really want to enter this challenge/competition and google the website. Once you do, there will always be instructions for you to follow. Good luck!

1- never sing a song of the company you doing the audition they go think you is a fan crazy, so, sing a music in version English 2-don't use much makeup use in the maximum a base, they want to see your natural beauty 3- if they ask your instagram or Facebook or another app, delete all the photos of KPOP, if no they go think you is a Sasaeng want to stalk a idol 4- never do cute gestures they go think you want to be Korean, and this is not cool

I mean come on how hard is it, just search up the name of the company u wanna audition for (like jyp,sm,yg etc). Like search up jyp online audition or sum and click on the first page and it should take u to the audition page rite. Then using logic u click apply, online application, agree to terms and conditions and then either fill out the form or send them an email under the address they've told u to send it to (they prolly will have a specific layout they want the email to have so make sure to read the iistructions carefully). In reality it's all simple and logical so u shouldnt need help lmao. Good luck tho

*FIRSTLY* If you want to audition to become a kpop idol it basically depends on these things : 1)Country you belong to 2)A girl/boy just in case you want to audition for Bighit you gotta have those balls and be a 1999 born or afterwards no excuses to that 3)Looks that are typically approved by south Korean standards *SECONDLY* Well if you have bravely survived the previous round, I don't think so there are many online auditions held for kpop but this might help you. Rochu Megurine's answer to Is there any K-pop online audition in 2019?

• Send them a good quality video and photo (that have a clear and nice view of your face). And always look good on it. • On the application form, if they ask for your experience, it’s best to not leave it empty..try to show them that you have some experiences in the past (unless you are still young now) • Be prepared to pay for your own flight ticket if you pass the online audition. You’ll have another live audition

I would try to describe my positive traits and how they can be used in the industry. Sometimes there’s a rubric for writing about achievements, but if there isn’t, I would put it there as well if there is something note-worthy. I think the most important thing is showing why you would do well as a trainee in their company. It’s a little like a job application. Positive traits and how you can use them in your pursuit to become an idol. (But this is just 100 % guess) Thanks for the A2A ^^

You need to start from finding a company that is holding a global audition. There are many at the moment like, JYP/ Belift/Pnation/Yg etc… So next is choosing a category to film for. Model/Vocal/Actor/Dance/Rap and the tricky part is what to put inside your reel. I have made a demo of what to put in all 5 categories and you can take a look ! Hope this helps

If you are planing to do an online kpop audition, it’s not very likely to get chosen I’d suggest you go to public or private auditions because that way the judges can actually see you doing things in person People who audition online does get picked but only a few sk I suggest do an online audition if you’re really confident about your singing and dancing

If you're going to do audition and get confuse for self-introduction . You should write something that show your character, smething that make you look you have skill-and make sure you really have skills. And it should make the reader remember your name.. Although the reader only read once.

Most K-pop Entertainment agencies have online auditions, and all you have to do is go to their website and most of the time, they’ll have a section called “audition.” Then you read the instructions and continue from there. I wish you luck! I would recommend bigger companies if you can’t speak Korean, as they have instructions written in English and are usually more welcoming to foreigners. JYP: JYP Audition YG: http://yg-audition.com SM: AUDITION I just linked the big 3 companies, which you might wanna try first. Good luck!

Just go to their website if you wanna audition on companies you can simply search on Google their names for example if you want to give jyp audition simply search on Google jyp audition and you will find their website just click on it submit some details and your audition will complete they will let you know if you get selected good luck💜✨✨✨ (Upvote kar dena sis ) - upvote it sis 😅 Hope u will get selected ☺️

I can't give any personal tips but it's difficult. For sure, DO NOT sing songs like I will always love you. Agencies are sick of listening to those all the time. Make sure you have interesting things in your bio.

I'm not so sure about other companies but I've found YG entertainment smule acc. It's definitely verified they provide some songs to use for free and you need to show your face (use front camera to add video)

First Go to the company site. Choose the option audition, which might me on the top right There u will find email audition. Fill in the form.Some timed you have to download the form or the for might be in the site. Attach your video and photoes send it to them by email.

my Advice for anyone who is trying out is just to be yourself!!!! Being yourself is the best thing you can do on the audition. Also don’t forget to be confident so that way you don’t be scared:) I wish you luck!!

Companies hold auditions and announce the auditions once they’re ready to debut or want to debut a new group. You may have a certain company you’d like it join, right? So it’s best to look up the companies twitter and check whether they are holding auditions or not.

You can look up on a search engine “(insert entertainment company) audition” or go to their website and find a link. Usually, you will have to submit a form by email and all the instructions are on the website. Good luck!
You go to the audition website for the company you want to audition for and fill out the form. If you have any specific companies in mind, tell me and I can find the audition site for you!
Go online search the companies you who’s to audition for. They should have an email. Or information on where to send your audition videos.
Visit their website and read the instruction
Step 1: whatever you want to audition for go to their website Step 2: go to audition Step 3: get all the inform And apply online
